clinical_study.brief_title: A Study on Diagnosis and Treatment of End Stage Liver Disease Complicated With Infection (SESLDIR Study)
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Study on Diagnosis and Treatment of End Stage Liver Disease Complicated With Infection (SESLDIR Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The term of End Stage of Liver Disease (ESLD) was raised in 80's of 20 Century, but without a restrict definition. Infections are the cause and effect in occurrence and development of ESLD, which not only induce or exacerbate ESLD, but also are the most combined complication. Multi-resistant bacteria, multi-organ injury, selection of anti-microbes, supporting treatment, disorder of intestine microbiota, et al are dilemma in clinical practice. Appropriate and formal diagnosis and treatment of ESLD combined infection are imperious nowadays.

primary_outcome.measure: Complete response rate to empirical antibiotic treatment
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients who achieved complete recovery from combined infection after empirical antibiotic treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Non-liver transplant survival rate at 30 days, 60 days and 6 months after empirical antibiotic treatment
Days of hospitalization after empirical antibiotic treatment

arm_group.description: Patients with end stage liver disease with infection
Patients with end stage liver disease without infection

intervention.description: This is an observation study, no specific antibiotics will be indicated during treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Decompensation of liver cirrhosis:
1. ALB <35 g / L; A / G <1.0
2. TBIL> 35μmol / L;
3. ALT> 1 × ULN and / or AST> 1 × ULN
4. PTA <60%
5. Ascites or hepatic encephalopathy or esophageal variceal bleeding
Acute-on-chronic liver failure:
1. Chronic liver disease based on: chronic hepatitis or decompensated cirrhosis
2. onset time: <4 weeks
3. Hepatic encephalopathy: with or without
4. Coagulation: PTA ≤ 40% or INR ≥ 1.5
5. Jaundice: TBIL ≥ 171μmol / L or daily increase ≥ 17.1μmol / L
Chronic liver failure:
1. The basis of chronic liver disease: decompensated cirrhosis
2. onset time: -
3. Hepatic encephalopathy: with or without
4. Coagulation: PTA ≤ 40% or INR ≥ 1.5 Jaundice: significantly higher
Exclusion Criteria:
